subject: RE: [junit] generating historical graph of test results
msgSnippet: That s exactly the approach I m planning to take.  I just didn t want to build my own solution if someone s already built something to do this. I guess I can
messageBody:
That's exactly the approach I'm planning to take. I just didn't want to
build my own solution if someone's already built something to do this.
I guess I can assume by the lack of response on this list that there
probably isn't an open source tool that already does everything I'm
looking for.


Todd.



________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
Behalf Of Robert Watkins
Sent: Thursday, May 12, 2005 5:34 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] generating historical graph of test results


Bradley, Todd wrote:
> Has anyone else put something like this together? Mike
mentioned he's
> heard of others who want to build such a results graphing
tool, but
> didn't know if anyone's got one they're sharing. So I'm
posting here,
> looking for pointers.

Bradley, I've been thinking of something similar.

I understand that Agitar's tool can do something like this,
which may be a
starting point if you've got more money than time (I don't know
the price
of Agitator, but I understand it's not cheap).

Given your particular requirements, I would suggest using a tool
such as
CruiseControl to regularly run builds, saving the XML log files
away, and
post-processing them afterwards to produce the data you desire.

Robert.

--
"Software is too expensive to build cheaply"
Robert Watkins http://twasink.net/
robertdw@...
